sen.j: 大伴 宿奈麻呂（おおとも の すくなまろ、生没年不詳）は、奈良時代前期の官人。
sen.e: OTOMO no Sukunamaro (year of birth and death unknown) was a government official in the early Nara period.
OTOMO no Sukunamaro (year of birth and death unknown) was a government official in the early Nara period.
OTOMO no Sukunamaro (year of birth and death unknown) was a government official in the early Nara period.
His kabane (hereditary title) was 'Sukune.'
His kabane (hereditary title) was 'Sukune.'
His kabane (hereditary title) was 'Sukune.'

sen.j: 大納言大伴安麻呂の三男。
sen.e: He was the third son of OTOMO no Yasumaro, a dinagon (major councilor).
He was the third son of OTOMO no Yasumaro, a dainagon (major councilor).
He was the third son of OTOMO no Yasumaro, a Dainagon (Chief councilor of state).
His mother is unknown.
His mother is unknown.
His mother is unknown.

sen.j: 兄弟に大伴旅人・大伴田主・大伴稲公がおり、異母妹の大伴坂上郎女を妻にした。
sen.e: OTOMO no Tabito, OTOMO no Tanushi, and OTOMO no Inakimi numbered among his brothers, and OTOMO no Sakanoue no Iratsume, a paternal half-sister, was his wife.
OTOMO no Tabito, OTOMO no Tanushi, and OTOMO no Inakimi numbered among his brothers, and OTOMO no Sakanoue no Iratsume, a paternal half-sister, was his wife.
OTOMO no Tabito, OTOMO no Tanushi, and OTOMO no Inakimi numbered among his brothers, and OTOMO no Sakanoue no Iratsume, a paternal half-sister, was his wife.

sen.j: 田村大嬢（大伴稲公室）・坂上大嬢（大伴家持室）・坂上二嬢（大伴駿河麻呂室）の父。
sen.e: Sukunamaro was the father of TAMURA no Ootome (the wife of OTOMO no Inakimi), OTOMO no SAKANOUE no Oiratsume (the wife of OTOMO no Yakamochi) and SAKANOUE no Otoiratsume (the wife of OTOMO no Surugamaro).

Sukunamaro was the father of TAMURA no Ootome (the wife of OTOMO no Inakimi), OTOMO no SAKANOUE no Oiratsume (the wife of OTOMO no Yakamochi) and SAKANOUE no Otoiratsume (the wife of OTOMO no Surugamaro).

Sukunamaro was the father of TAMURA no Otome (the wife of OTOMO no Inakimi), OTOMO no SAKANOUE no Oiratsume (the wife of OTOMO no Yakamochi) and SAKANOUE no Otoiratsume (the wife of OTOMO no Surugamaro).

sen.j: 和銅元年（708年）1月、従五位上に叙せられる。
sen.e: In January 708, he was created Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).
In January 708, he was created Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).
In February 708, he was created Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).

sen.j: 和銅4年5月、左衛士督になる。
sen.e: In May 711, he was appointed as Saejinokami (Captain of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards
sen.cmt: 原文では「近衛府」は「左衛士督」になっています。
sen.e: In May 711, he was appointed as Saejinokami (Captain of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards
In May 711, he was appointed as Saejinokami (Captain of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards
sen.cmt: ウェブで確認し、原文も訂正しました。

sen.j: 養老3年（719年）7月には備前国守在任中であったが安芸国・周防国の按察使に任ぜられる。
sen.e: In July 719, while in the post of Bizen no kami (Governor of Bizen Province), he was appointed as Azechi (inspector of the provincial government) of Aki and Subo Provinces.
In July 719, while in the post of Bizen no kami (Governor of Bizen Province), he was appointed as Azechi (inspector of the provincial government) of Aki and Subo Provinces.
In July 719, while in the post of Bizen no kami (Governor of Bizen Province), he was appointed as Azechi (inspector of the provincial government) of Aki and Subo Provinces.

sen.j: 神亀元年（724年）、従四位下に昇叙。
sen.e: In 724, he was upgraded to Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
In 724, he was promoted to Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
In 724, he was promoted to Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 神亀元年（724年）より以前、宮仕えする恋人に対する歌があり、『万葉集』にはこの2首のみ残る。
sen.e: Sukunamaro wrote poets prior to 724, which was dedicated to his lover serving in the Imperial Court, and these two verses are the only works remained in "Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves (namely, Japanese poetry)).

Sukunamaro wrote poems prior to 724, which were dedicated to his lover serving in the Imperial Court, and these two verses, collected in the "Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves (namely, Japanese poetry)), are his only remaining works.

Sukunamaro wrote poems prior to 724, which were dedicated to his lover serving in the Imperial Court, and these two verses, collected in the "Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves [namely, Japanese poetry]), are his only remaining works.
sen.cmt: 括弧内の括弧を[]に変更

sen.j: 没年は不詳だが、おそらく神亀4年（727年）頃までに亡くなったと思われる。
sen.e: The year of his death is unknown, but it is considered that he was dead by around 727.
The year of his death is unknown, but he is considered to have been dead by around 727.
The year of his death is unknown, but he is considered to have been dead by around 727.

sen.j: また『万葉集』（4-759）によれば田村里（現在の奈良県奈良市尼辻町）に住んでいたことが知られ、時に右大弁だった。
sen.e: According to "Manyoshu" (4-759), he is known to have lived in the village of Tamura (currently, Amatsuji-machi, Nara City, Nara Prefecture), and at that time, he was a Udaiben (Major Controller of the Right).
sen.cmt: 「弁官」は原文では「右大弁」です。
sen.e: According to the "Manyoshu" (4-759), he is known to have lived in the village of Tamura (currently Amatsuji-machi, Nara City, Nara Prefecture), and at that time, he was an Udaiben (Major Controller of the Right).
